pmdplyr 0.1.1
  • Reference

Data on Earnings and Loan Repayment in US Four-Year Colleges

Scorecard.Rd

From the College Scorecard, this data set contains by-college-by-year data on how students who attended those colleges are doing.

Scorecard

Format

A data frame with 48,445 rows and 8 variables:

unitid

College identifiers.

inst_name

Name of the college or university.

state_abbr

Two-letter abbreviation for the state the college is in.

pred_degree_awarded_ipeds

Predominant degree awarded. 1 = less-than-two-year, 2 = two-year, 3 = four-year+

year

Year in which outcomes are measured.

earnings_med

Median earnings among students (a) who received federal financial aid, (b) who began as undergraduates at the institution ten years prior, (c) with positive yearly earnings.

count_not_working

Number of students who are not working (not necessarily unemployed) and (a) who received federal financial aid, (b) who began as undergraduates at the institution ten years prior.

count_working

Number of students who are working (not necessarily unemployed) and (a) who received federal financial aid, (b) who began as undergraduates at the institution ten years prior.

repay_rate

Proportion of students who received federal loans as an undergraduate at this institution and who entered repayment seven years ago who are not in default, has paid off all accrued interest, and is still making progress on payment. Only available 2013-2016.

Source

Education Data Portal (Version 0.4.0 - Beta), Urban Institute, Center on Education Data and Policy, accessed June 28, 2019. https://educationdata.urban.org/documentation/, Scorecard.

Details

This data is not just limited to four-year colleges and includes a very wide variety of institutions.

Note that the labor market (earnings, working) and repayment rate data do not refer to the same cohort of students.

Data was downloaded using the Urban Institute's educationdata package.
